text:
Assume a tag library is packaged within a jar and its TLD is in WEB-
INF/taglib.tld of the jar. There're no <taglib> entries in application's 
web.xml. Application context is reloadable. 
If I replace the jar with a newer version that contains an incorrectly formed 
taglib.tld, then:
1) No parse exception is logged anywhere although the error happens for sure 
because syntax of taglib.tld is incorrect. However if I restart Tomcat, I get 
the reasonable org.xml.sax.SAXParseException message in logs/catalina.out.
2) If I do not restart a Tomcat and correct the taglib.tld, this correction is 
not being catched by Tomcat until I restart it. Even web application's 
reinstallation via manager webapp doesn't help.
creator: ayud@mail.ru
remm@apache.org
text:
JAR reloading may not be very reliable, apparently because of JDK limitations. 
I don't know any workaround for this yet.

When you change a library you must redeploy the webapp with the manager
application.

Only a directory deployment the files at WEB-INF/classes must redeploy when
changed. 

I hope your taglib file is at META-INF/tablib.tld or it never parse.
